21.title: A Kid Explains The History of Christmas
21.plot: Christmas is Mr. Q's favorite holiday, so naturally he wanted to find out where it comes from. When did Christians first start celebrating the birth of Jesus? What is the festival known as Saturnalia? And how did Santa Claus get his name? Allow Mr. Q to clue you in.

22.title: A Kid Explains The First Black President
22.plot: Mr. Q examines a really important thing that happened in the U.S.A. just over ten years ago, something that had been hard to imagine for most of its history. The election of the first African American President, Barack Hussein Obama.

23.title: A Kid Explains Caesar and Brutus
23.plot: Julius Caesar and Marcus Brutus were friends and confidants...before things went south. Mr. Q enlists the help of his friend Dr. D to tell us what happened next.

24.title: A Kid Explains The History of Kids
24.plot: Adam from "Adam's Answers" joins Mr. Q for his first ever collab. They talk about the history of being a kid. Or as they used to be known, mini-adults. AKA workers.

25.title: A Kid Explains The Pony Express
25.plot: Mr. Q gets out of the studio to go where history happened, on the spot in Gothenburg, Nebraska. He's there to investigate the Wild West mail service known as the PONY EXPRESS. We take instant communication for granted these days, but not so long ago it was really hard to get information across America in a timely fashion. The 1860's solution? Teenaged boys riding horses really fast.

26.title: A Kid Explains The Russian Revolution
26.plot: Have you ever wondered what Communism actually is? Or why the Russian Empire was replaced with the USSR? Come to think of it, what does the USSR stand for? Allow Mr. Q to explain.

27.title: A Kid Explains Vikings
27.plot: We think we know a lot about Vikings, but what's the truth? Where are they from? Why did they need all those combs? Mr. Q finds the answers.

28.title: A Kid Explains Washington D.C.
28.plot: Mr. Q goes on the spot to a place where history happens. Washington D.C. has been the capital of the United States for over two hundred years, but why was it chosen? Who designed it? And what does D.C. stand for anyway?

29.title: A Kid Explains Halloween
29.plot: Trick or treat, candy, costumes, Halloween is the best. If you have ever wondered where this holiday comes from and why we celebrate the way we do, Mr. Q is here to fill in the gaps.

30.title: A Kid Explains Confucius
30.plot: You've heard his name and probably heard a lot of his sayings, but do you know who Confucius really was? Mr. Q found and and would like to share what he has learned.

31.title: A Kid Explains Robin Hood
31.plot: Mr. Q examines how the legend of ROBIN HOOD has evolved over the last 700 years. First told in ballads, poems, books and plays, the story has also been the subject of LOTS of movies, including one released in 2018 starring Taron Egerton and Jamie Foxx.

32.title: A Kid Explains Hanukkah
32.plot: Happy Hanukkah. In 2018, the Festival of Lights begins on December 3rd. Mr. Q takes a look at the history behind this famous holiday - who were the Maccabees? What King's name meant "God Manifest"? Watch and find out.

33.title: A Kid Explains The Calendar
33.plot: Goodbye 2018 and hello 2019. But have you ever stopped to wonder how we started keeping track of the years? Who came up with the calendar anyway? And how long have we been using the one we use now? Mr. Q found out.

imdb.plot outline: 11 year-old Mr. Q loves diving into different parts of history and sharing what he learns in these short, fun videos. History is a big subject, but that doesn't mean kids should feel intimidated. After all, it's really just a story about us. People. Whether you're a fellow kid with questions or an adult who's looking for a refresher, A Kid Explains History is for you.
